reviews.review_text: The baguettes were made in house which is nice. Beautiful crust, light and crunchy. I ve tried several filling options. The non vegan options are all good and tasty. But I dont recommend the vegan banh mi. There are many more vegetable choices out there I don t know why they use vermicelli noodles as filling for the banh mi. But it is still 5 star for the traditional banh mi and homemade baguette.
Amazing spot for banh mi.  Bread is super fresh, flaky on the outside but soft on the inside.  Service is very quick and efficient.

(CASH ONLY!) Best vegan banh mi in Vancouver. There is just the one option (the veggie banh mi with no mayo), and one is all you need. The crunch of the baguette   and the jalapeno cannot be topped. My go to place. Dietary restrictions: Vegan

Really fresh bread so crunchy! I need this type of food to soak the booze after my gambling sessions. The taste makes me forget how much money I have lost . I cant believe it. I will buy this coffee all the time , its so roasty I forget all my money burned. It puts me into a different state of mind. Parking: Beside the location
Very affordable banh mi. Delicious at any time of the day! Made super fresh. Highly recommended.

This is definitely my go-to place for banh mi.  Ive been to other shops and they just dont live up to this place where the price point is great and they dont skimp on ingredients!  They make their own bread so you can see and smell it as soon as you step inside.  I also recommend their iced coffee!  There is no dine-in and be prepared to bring cash as they dont take any form of card.
I never expect that Banh Mi place in Vancouver this good! $8 for the huge banh mi , also the drinks are juicy and fresh!! Definitely come back later if travel to Vancouver again!
Super yummy, cheap, and a great atmosphere. The cute witch hats for halloween that some of the servers wore added to the nice vibe. Only had to wait a few minutes before food was ready. Great place!
The BEST banh mi in Vancouver.  We always get the #5 cold cut special, always buy 10 and get 1 free.  They bake their own bread and they are not cheap with the fixings.

Gem alert! Best 6 colors dessert Ive had! Not too sweet and great pandan jelly thats squishy and creamy. All the foods here tasted homemade. They bake their baguettes on site. Their banh mi tasted fresh and the flavours were all good. There was a good mix of crunchy veggies, pate, and meat on a crispy baguette. The DAC biet special banh mi was my favorite. Their fresh sugar cane juice was so refreshing and a must try! Also, their jumbo steamed bao was sooooo good and fluffy with savory juicy meat stuffing.  Very satisfying Vietnemese food! Be prepared to line up...

The Vietnamese subs here are always excellent! Fresh and tasty! Price has been going up just like everything else. $8 now for the house special. But its a good portion so still worth it! Love this place! Highly recommended!

Best banh mi in town. I have yet to find a yummier spot for this delicious Vietnamese sub. The cost for one is still very reasonable too and they have other Vietnamese foods like pastries and desserts that are yummy and authentic too.

When you go into a family owned restaurant for the first time, and the host is welcoming and excited for new people coming in. Very quick service food was phenomenal! Definitely recommend it for breakfast lunch and dinner. Watch out, when they get busy get solid out quick. Be early and grab extras. Parking: Parking may be a bit hard, but if you re ok to walk, you could find parking anywhere on street, side streets parking lots within a few mins.
Love their Banh Mis! Always stop here before a hike or picnic to pickup a banh mi. So fresh and tasty, and great iced coffee. Cash only

For many years I have enjoyed the fantastic options and made on-site fresh baguettes at Banh Mi Saigon. There have been times weve driven well out of our way to enjoy this bustling family business. Open quite early and the drink options are very tasty also!
The bread is so crunchy and flakey and always fresh.  Love the jalapeno and the fillings.

Had a craving for Vietnamese sandwiches and found this very small, corner location sandwich shop. No seating inside. Take out only. Not much to look at but staff is very friendly and cheerful, even though theyre busy. Cash only. You order your food than wait outside. They have a speaker outside so you can hear your number. You dont wait long. I waited about 5 minutes to finally get my order of 7 banhs. All the great reviews are bang on. First, everything is made to order and the banh is made fresh. Good crunch on outside and soft inside. Theyre bigger than most, about 12 inches long. We ordered their Special, their Bacon which is pork belly. Their Chicken, Lemongrass pork and marinated pork.  Plus their meat ball banh. All were delicious and worth the $6.50 to $7.00 each price tag. Oh they number the sandwiches according to the menu number. This way you know what type each is. Good touch. Give the place a try.

First time trying out this place. We ordered chicken and pork, plus the Vietnamese Ice coffee. The sandwiches are delicious. Its $6 a sandwich.  We will visit here again to try different flavor next time. This place close at 5pm and usually have line-up outside the store.

Coincidentally happened to be in the neighbourhood so I nabbed two that I have been coveting for weeks. The #1 - Special Dac Biet with a plethora of proteins and the #3 - Chicken Ga The baguette is absolute perfection and the sandwich just gets better from there. Cash only   - don t make the mistake I did. However, they were extremely nice and let me place my order while I went to an ATM. You can t go wrong with any of the choices. Your taste buds will thank you profusely.

Freshly made $6 12 subs.  Friendly and efficient staff.  Expect line ups as this is a popular spot.  No eating in due to covid safety protocol. Ordered their #1 best seller, house special  (similar to cold cuts) and lemongrass pork.

Been getting my sandwiches from here for years now. Bread is really good. Ingredients always fresh. Only does take out now. Service is always friendly. The only thing is that sometimes there is a wait but its because they are so busy.

We had a good experience so it seems like past negative issues in reviews has been corrected. Service was friendly. We got the #1 Special and #5 Cold Cut, as well as a Che 6 Mau drink. I took my order slip and waited outside about five minutes. When I got the food I mentioned the last time I had that Vietnamese drink was over twenty years ago. The server told me to stir it up. Back at the car the joke was East 38th Ave was Banh Mi Saigon s parking lot, seeing all the customers carrying bags of banh mis. You can also eat at the recently put in picnic tables at adjacent Jones Park. The two sandwiches were well packed with proteins and garnish. The bread had a thin crispy crust and was soft inside. The Che 6 Mau time-warped me back to 2am Vietnamese dinners in Chinatown in Toronto. Everything was, pardon my French, friggin  delicious. I will be back to try the other sandwiches and drinks. Tried the Fish Cake Sandwich and Pandan Jelly Dessert (drink). The fish cake had a very mild flavour. It was a nice alternative to the meat options, but for me a banh mi needs to have pate, so I will try the Vietnamese Bacon next. The pandan jelly itself did not have any flavour-I was expecting herbal. So it was more textural, but the mung bean and coconut taste was very good. If I had it again I would ask for mostly mung bean if they would do that. Daniel

Very delicious and great price (around $5.50). I had a lemon grass pork and iced coffee (probably could have skipped the iced coffee, a bit on the watery side for me with too much ice). But the sub was amazing. The bread tasted fresh and the ingredients were great all together! The prep area looks clean and efficient as well!
The sandwiches are huge and delicious for $7. The owner is very nice and friendly. I definitely will come back. If you go to Vancouver, this is a place you should stop.

One of the best banh mis in Vancouver. Definitely worth the drive. Not only are they long, but the flavors are amazing and fresh. They also take the time to hand-make a lot of the items, such as the pickles and mayo. In addition, the prices for their most expensive sandwiches are 8$ [May 2023]...definitely a steal. Recommend the special. Others are just as great.

Awesome and authentic banh mi! The food there brought back all my memories in Vietnam. The subs are so cheap - CAD5.5 each. You never need to wait long, as the service is super fast. Most of the people take out, while there are some tables there.

Best Banh Mi (Vietnamese sub) in Vancouver, bar none. Take out only. The bun is soft, yet crunchy, moist and delicious. The protein selections are great, everything is just plain yummy delicious. And theres almost always a lineup.
10/10 really good price for tasty banh mi! The best one I ve ever had. Size of baguette is twice the size of regular places.

A banh mi for $8 you cannot beat!  Theyre larger than your average ones you usually get elsewhere so you can definitely share if you wanted (though you probably wont want to.)  Got the dac biet and it was delicious. Solid banh mi. Cant rave enough about it.  I went at 1030am and there was no line; even had the single prime parking spot right up front.
Fantastic banh mi!! Definitely recommend the special roll. The baguette is so crispy and the meat is fantastic. Will definitely come back for more!

It was my first time here, I was not aware about it being cash-only. The guy working at the til helped me find an atm for my bank & my sub was ready to go when I came back (and it was really busy)! 10/10 service and even better sub. Will be coming back, thank you for starting my Saturday off right!!
Authentic, fresh and delicious Banh Mi!  The baguette is so crispy yet soft.  Size is big for a person.  I like #1 special but heard a lot of people ordering #5 cold cut.

This place is a gem, all Banh Mi all the time. Seriously though the menu is pretty much only sandwiches, which are delicious. For $6.60 you get a tasty sub that s almost the length of your arm. It s all served up on some delicious in house baked bread.
I love this place. Bread is crisp and fillings are hearty.  I love it when the bread is freshly baked in the morning. They are usually busy here and there s usually a line waiting for the sandwiches.

Quick service and tasty banh mi :) I really like their special banh mi and the chicken banh mi. Prices have been going up in the past year so expect to pay around $8 for a banh mi now. My go to place for banh mi

This place has been slinging sandwiches for a few years now, and although the price has nearly doubled (from 3.75 to 6 dollars today), its still the best deal on Victoria. The bread is baked fresh every morning, so its beautifully crunchy yet fluffy too, and they have homemade mayo too which adds another layer of rich goodness. If you can handle the line (which can wrap around the block at times), definitely get one of their banh mis.

Their Banh Mi is simply THE best! With so many Vietnamese restaurants on the same block they still stand out as the one with the best BANH MI overall. The price is more than reasonable. The only problem is I don t want to buy from anyone else now

First time visiting this store and wasn t sure what to get. Was my turn, walked in and still took me a while to decide (no one was behind me), but the owner didn t rush me, instead told me to take my time and even answered my questions patiently. We ended up ordering #1 special & #5 cold cut. By far the best banh mi we had so far Clean organized store. Great experience and happy tummy. Would give one more star if I could.
Delicious banh mi. The sandwich is huge which can be share with one more person. Highly recommended to try Vietnamese Sandwiches

The Banh Mi was ok. I have had better. I asked the staff to cut my sandwich in half since it was so long and they said  no  .. It was such a easy task but don t know why they won t do it. Will try somewhere else next time.
The best Vietnamese sub. Bread are freshly made at the spot. Services are fast and kind. Very clean and hygiene. Totally recommended
First time came here and randomly chose three, but the owner recommended me their popular lemongrass pork, special, and chicken. I like the baguette so much and definitely will come often.

Updated: Get the Dac Biet! This place is my favorite for banh mi and cafe sua da. Fresh, not dry, great ratio for ingredients and great price. Call ahead to place your order   Please open in Richmond! Pleasantly surprised! This place was packed on a weekday afternoon. Waited at least 15 mins to get my fresh banh mi special. Buns were crispy on outside and soft on inside. The flavours were yummy. Great menu! Cafe sua da was nice and strong!

Legit banh mi place.  Portion is good and taste is yummy.  Ive had a few of their banh mi and the dac biet is the the best.  $6 and you cant go wrong.  Covid protocols in place and service is quick.  They also have dessert but I have yet to try it.  One of the 2 places I go to for banh mi (the other place is a bit hipster) when Im in Vancouver.  Overall would recommend if you in the mood for a Viet subway.
I was parked nearby while my partner ordered 2 sandwiches...we ate in the car. Got crumbs all over the car. Food

This was my first time there. I will be back! A friendly smile greeted me, the sandwich was prepared in seconds, the bread is baked there and you can tell. It s crunchy outside, tender and fluffy inside. My lemongrass pork was juicy and flavourful, huge portions and all that for just $8!
The longest banh mi I ve ever had and it s delicious too! The fresh sugarcane juice taste like the one I had in Vietnam.
First time here. we got the special sandwich. Quick and crisped delicious. The man at the counter was friendly :) This is a grab n go spot. Order and leave

Delicious.  Ive been coming here for some time now.  Sandwiches are always fresh.  Wide variety of selections.  Friendly staff.  Reasonably priced.  Cant get any better than this.  Highly recommended.

No doubt that their queue is always long. I ordered number 1 and the banh mi is so huge with lots of ham and meat. Their pickle is exceptional, really authentic Vietnamese food. The tamarind juice and sugar cane juice are fresh and amazing after a banh mi feast. Worth trying!
Super fresh bread and excellent fillings. I got the chicken bahn mi and it is the best bahn Ive tried in Vancouver so far. Service is super quick and efficient

Very likely one of the best Bahn Mi spot in town, lots of selections and they bake their own bread. The flavor is great and there are any toppings. They work like a production like and larger order should not take too long. They also run a special of buy 10 get 1 free and I just buy and freeze them for the next week.
Hands down, best, freshest bang mi in town, full stop.  Get in early or they might be sold out before the shop closes.
Lunch for $7!  Banh Mi larger than usual size.  Baguette is so fresh and outer crust so flaky.  Rich flavors.  Go-to lunch spot for price as its filling, too.

Amazing Banh Mi!  Picked up two banh mi for our Stanley Park bike ride.  Very crunchy bread, veggies, and meat.  Pate was delish.  Everything was fresh! We had a super hot pepper in ours, so for those who cant take the heat beware or just leave it out.
Prices are low, service is fast, bread baked in house, sandwiches are fresh.  Place is busy all the time so be prepared to wait.  Recommend to try it

I shall dream of the sandwiches here. They were so good, I didnt even take decent photos of them. I had 2; the special and the lemongrass. The bread.... the bread is amazing. Thin and crispy shell that just cracks when you bite into it with a soft and fluffy but satisfyingly chewy inside. The bread is amazing. The sandwiches here are godly. The price was like 6 or 7 dollars for a sandwich. An extremely good deal as they are very long. 2 sandwiches will fill you up for a full day.
I loved their special sub. Great value and delicious. Perfect sandwich for pinics, the beach, and hikes.

Had a friend bring over some banh mi from here for lunch recently, and wow they were good!! The bread is crunchy outside and soft inside, and the fillings are delicious. I got to try the house (with a bit of extra pate cause my friend is a genius) and a grilled pork. Both were really good though the House was slightly better, would definitely be my go to. Definitely a must try if you like banh mi!

Always coming here for banh mi and husband loves their meat loaf ones. This time I saw a dark drink on the front counter ( no idea what it was) and ask to get one ( cashier lady was nice and told me should get two , while I was thinking to try one frist ). End up it was grass jelly and chia seed drink   and it is good (sweetness like bubble tea level) . I should had bought two.. hubby loves it and we were fighting over the one we got

This is the best banh mi in Vancouver! I ate the special, vietnamese coffee and 6 color dessert was perfect for a summer lunch. Expect a line because this place gets really busy! This is a must try when visiting Vancouver!

I could go on about the price or the food but lets just cut to it. Fresh bread, ingredients and oh so good. I went with the special with double meat. Delicious and wonderful. Give this place a shot. You will not be disappointed.
My favourite banh mi place in Vancouver! The quality of the bread is amazing as well as the variety. I will stop by everytime Im in the area!
Banh mis are really long and the meat are thick! Really yummy and well seasoned! Do not forget to bring cash as they do not accept cards!
Best Viet subs in town hands down! Always a line up but always worth the wait!!
Banh mi and iced coffee both delicious. Overall great sandwich but the extremely good bread is the best part. Will go here  again

Had the Special & the Cold-Cut Banh Mi.   Both were amazing in taste and texture.  The ingredients were all fresh, the bread was exactly what you want in a Vietnamese sub (crunchy on the outside, soft chewy on the inside.  @veryhangryguy
Great Banh Mi.  Fast paced take out place.  Great baguette.  So fresh.  Reasonably priced.

Cash only, but best banh mi in town. I get the chicken bahn mi. Best to get there early before the lunch rush. The fresh baked bread is the best. The parking is not ideal, but I only complain because I live in the neighborhood and it makes the traffic kind of nutty sometimes. Tip is to go during the colder weather, the lines arent as long, the summer is bad news bears, the line is down the street.

My absolute favorite place in Vancouver for banh mi. They are efficient, clean and make tasty subs! Dont worry if you see a lineup for banh mi, as their system (like a production line!) makes subs after subs in a flash. I love the classic cold cut. It is full of flavour and lots of meat.

The breads are crispy, the ingredients are plentiful. Definitely going to be my new sandwich place. However, when I asked them to cut the sandwich in half because I wanted to split it with my friend, they said they wouldnt cut it and offered me a plastic knife, which was hilarious.

Bring cash. The wait is worth the reward. I order in advance over the phone to skip the line. If youre a meat lover like myself, I order the house special with extra pate, and order the jalapenos on the side.
6$ banh mi, tasty, and filling :). There is always a line up in front of the store but it goes pretty fast.

Pretty busy place but they got everyone served fairly quick. One of the best Vietnamese sandwiches Ive had in Vancouver. Friendly staff as well. Ill go out of my way to eat there again. Parking: Might have to park a block away at the most Kid-friendliness: They were friendly with my 6 year old

This place, is by far, the best banh mi in Vancouver. Dont go any where else. They freshly bake their bread and the ingredients were super fresh and tasty. I tried their desert 6 beans. I loved it! Highly recommended.

Best Banh MI in the city!!! The bread is killer and the little pork pastries by the cash are the bomb. Cant beat the prices and its always busy. Get there early or they might be sold out. The house special is killer and the Xiu Mai is out of this world. They make all the meats in house. The veggies are so fresh and has a just the right amount of mayo and spice with the fish sauce coming through to add just the right flavours and bringing it all together. Must try, guaranteed not to be disappointed.

Banh mi was super tasty - love the flaky baguette (don t care if it was messy to eat in the car LOL  ) and good priced despite inflation. The 6 color dessert drink is a must have to top off the meal. New fave - been back again already   .
Bunmi was delicious.  Best sandwiches ever. We did order special one and had good amount of meat bread was fresh. The 7 layer dessert was so delicious.
Excellent customer service best bang mi in town i love them,   i always go back for more i hardly recommend you cant go wrong
Fresh french bread made on the spot. Assorted cold cuts or lemongrass pork are some of our favorites.

Love this bahn mi shop! Bread is baked fresh in house with a thin, crispy crust and a soft interior. Favourites are dac biet - very filling with lots of meat, and the lemongrass pork - warm, tender, fatty and flavourful. Pork pastries are also delicious, iced coffee is balanced. Expect to wait 5-20 min for your order, although they have lots of chairs/tables, most people take it to go. Everyone is very friendly, especially the owner, who always hands you your order with a smile.
Been coming here for years. The best bread of any banh mi in Vancouver and it s made fresh in house! Hard to beat this place for its quality and quantity!
Long line up which is a good sign. But worth the wait (goes fast)
I tried once and it s my fav place for Vietnamese sub. Stopped over there yesterday and realized that it is under renovation. Does anyone know when it will reopen?
Wonderfully fresh bread is perfect. Made to order Bahn Mi that is hard to beat. Family run, super friendly and very accommodating.
Delicious, good price, fast service. A constant line is proof this place is a local favourite. Wheelchair accessibility: Not accessible

Vietnamese Sub better than subway. Pros: cheap, lots of option, has dessert menu. French bread is home made. Everything is prep for the day, so if they sell out, it is out. 2 hour parking available but limited. You can eat in doors or take out. Great for large parties. Cons: hard to find. Parking is limited. Food option is limited after 6pm.
Food was amazing!! Bacon sandwich was new for me but 5 stars!!
Loved their subs.  I would say their subs are usually bigger than usual Viet subs.  They close shop when theyve sold out on bread.

Huge banh mi (viet subs) for cheap price. The line sometimes moves quite slow because people order so many and everything is freshly made, including the buns. Great taste, great value  be careful if you can t eat spicy, there are some hot peppers in there

Quality bread (the bread really makes it), quality ingredients, super tasty, great affordable price. So Go! Now! Just remember to bring cold hard cash (remember that?) - they dont take any other form of payment.
delicious and fresh banh mi! theres always a line here but their service is quick and efficient. big fan of the com chay cha bong (crispy rice crackers with pork floss)

Bread is fresh. The toppings are good and flavourful. Service is fast and efficient. Park nearby to take a break and relax with your food. If you take it home, take a few minutes to toaster oven it if you have a toaster oven. WATCH OUT for spicy peppers if you are sensitive to heat. My top picks: #1 & chicken.
Who loves vietnamiese sandwiches Banh Mi wont be dissapointed. $4.5 - 5.    CASH ONLY
This is a place has a great banh mi in Vancouver.  Buy for to go is a good choice here.  The place is very small.

Theyre known as the OG spot for Banh Mis for a reason. Come in the morning and grab a few beef pastries before they sell out (because they always do). One of the only spots left thats fairly priced for banh mis and is amazing in flavour.
Best banh mi Ive had in Vancouver. The Vietnamese coffee is on point.
Best banh mi Ive had outside of Vietnam, the hit of jalapeno is really nice. Go to park next door to enjoy it outside
Ok...my wife and kids love this place.  They always order the special.  Fresh bread is a highlight for them.   But for me I am torn between this place and another.

Excellent value banh mi for the size. Would have liked more filling but reasonable given the price. Also a wide variety of drinks to choose from, like sugar cane & 3 coloue drink, which is probably where they actually make money. There is often a line here but it moves quite quickly. Cash only!
